originalText.text: Convenient from NJ for followup appointment. DO NOT TRUST website info about parking. There is no special rate at the I park, it's the same 50 bucks/12 hrs that everyone gets charged, but it will be less if you are parked there for only a couple of hours. HSS do better, the attendant said that deal changed THREE YEARS ago.

originalText.text: Made an appointment for physical therapy for a month out with Hudson Yards HSS. HSS told me online they accepted my insurance when I was booking. However when I double checked with my insurance they said the provider is not coming up. I called HSS Hudson Yards PT office and spoke with Jennifer. She told me it was her job to check if I was insured and that said she would get back to me. When I asked for a timeline she said she'd get back to me in 3 weeks time, a week before my appointment. I told her that was a long time for simply verifying eligibility, she said the whole office is backed up for 3 weeks making those calls for people. So at that point in 3 weeks time if I'm not covered I'll need to find another physio and wait an additional month. The hudson yards office is very inefficient and not very courteous either. My guess is this call was just the tip of the iceberg. If it takes 3 weeks to check eligibility, I wonder how long it would take to get a billing error fixed with HSS Hudson Yards.

originalText.text: Pro: Experienced physical therapists, brand new, state of the art facility, some receptionists like Lavana are great. Con: it takes forever and it is a mess to schedule a PT appointment, therapists multitask patients a lot, most receptionists seems annoyed to help patients, Dana A showed little regard for my care. Overall, not the quality care one would expect from HSS.

text.text: Pro: Experienced physical therapists, brand new, state of the art facility, some receptionists like Lavana are great. Con: it takes forever and it is a mess to schedule a PT appointment, therapists multitask patients a lot, most receptionists seems annoyed to help patients, Dana A showed little regard for my care. Overall, not the quality care one would expect from HSS.

originalText.text: Dr Griffin is an excellent doctor: extremely smart and knowledgeable, attentive and patient-focused. I had a stubborn pain in my lower back for many years before seeing him, and while other doctors just (lazily) blamed my herniated disk, Dr Griffin ordered a detailed MRI and was the first one to establish an accurate diagnosis which included two independent lower back and hip problems. He was detailed, thorough and overall excellent. He also always returned my calls and answered any questions I had within a day. Literally, within a day of getting MRI results I was on the phone with him, and he walked me through the results and what they mean for my treatment. At all times I feel like I know exactly what is happening, why and what are the next steps. As patient, this is extremely important and yet not to be taken for granted - it is not the experience I have had with other spine specialists in NYC. The staff at HSS is also fantastic and it helps that the HSS has their own immaging/radiology department that can get any x rays and MRIs done quickly. I also love that there is a user-friendly HSS app where a patient can see all doctor's notes from past consultations and tests, and schedule or modify any appointments. Well done. Five stars on all counts.

originalText.text: Had both physical and occupational therapy at this wonderful place where everyone is so helpful, all the way down to whomever you speak to on the phone for appointments or information, Etc!
